message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.AI. 

The paper is about improving ad-hoc retrieval models, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR) in computer science. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes adversarial training methods, which is a common technique in machine learning (ML) for improving model robustness, suggesting that cs.LG (machine learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions using adversarial sampling to obtain difficult examples, which involves generating adversarial examples, a technique commonly used in computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP), suggesting that cs.CV and cs.CL are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves using semi-supervised learning, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (AI), suggesting that cs.AI is also a possible sub-category.
